H0.text: Digestive and skeletal systems are the two human body systems most responsible for getting oxygen to cells.

H1.text: Skeletal and circulatory systems are the two human body systems most responsible for getting oxygen to cells.

H2.text: The circulatory and respiratory systems are the two human body systems most responsible for getting oxygen to cells.

H3.text: The respiratory and digestive systems are the two human body systems most responsible for getting oxygen to cells.

A4.text: Blood is a fluid consisting of plasma, red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets; it is circulated around the body carrying oxygen and nutrients to the tissues and collecting and disposing of waste materials.

A5.text: Gas exchange occurs in the lungs, whereby CO2 is released from the blood, and oxygen is absorbed.
